alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin; Jackson; Osage; Pottawatomie; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 3:22AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Franklin, Shawnee, southwestern Douglas, northeastern Wabaunsee, northeastern Osage, southeastern Pottawatomie and southwestern Jackson Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 321 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Delia to 5 miles southwest of Globe. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Topeka, Carbondale, Rossville, Tecumseh, St. Marys, Richland, Silver Lake, Auburn, Overbrook, Centropolis, Delia, Willard, Pauline, Globe, Berryton and Pomona Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 344 and 355. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 168 and 186. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Douglas; Franklin; Jackson; Osage; Pottawatomie; Shawnee; Wabaunsee
